definitions: A Greek philosopher, son of Hermias, who lived in the 5th century AD and was a pupil of Proclus.

examples: The teachings of Ammonius influenced later Neoplatonists.
Ammonius was a prominent figure in the Alexandrian school.
Scholars study the works attributed to Ammonius.
Ammonius's ideas are discussed in ancient philosophy texts.
